CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Three donor - acceptor type of narrow band gap conjugated polymers with enlarged coplanar skeleton were synthesized via Stille copolymerization of indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) based monomers. The energy levels , absorption spectra and band gaps of the resulting polymers were well tuned by utilizing different thiophene derivatives as spacer between IDT and NT units , and polymer PIDT-C12NT which employed bithiophene attached with dodecyl side chain as spacer exhibited superior properties compared to the other two copolymers. All polymers exhibited deep highest occupied molecular orbital energy levels and subsequently lead to high open circuit voltages of fabricated solar cell devices. Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers. The results demonstrated that the combination of IDT and NT with appropriate spacers was a promising molecular design strategy for the application of solar cells . During the past decade , polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted extensive attention due to their lightweight , low cost and great potential for the fabrication of large - area flexible devices. 1-3 PSCs based on bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) architecture are of particular interests since high performance devices with power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) exceed 8% can be achieved. 4-9 Typical BHJ devices comprise a phaseseparated donor / acceptor blend layer with low band gap conjugated polymers as the electron donor , and fullerene derivatives such as [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as the electron acceptor. 10,11 Generally , when considering that open circuit voltage ( V oc ) is related to the difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level of donor materials and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy level of acceptor , 12,13 deep HOMO levels for low band gap conjugated polymers are preferred in order to attain high V oc . However , lowering HOMO level would result in larger band gap , and thereby the absorption of resulted polymers would have less overlap with solar spectrum , which are unfavorable for high short circuit current ( J sc ). To obtain the ideal low band gap polymer with appropriate energy levels that can make a tradeoff between open circuit voltage ( V oc ) and band gap so as to maximize the PCE , an intriguing approach involves incorporat - ing electron rich moieties ( donor , D ) and electron deficient moieties ( acceptor , A ) and alternating them on the backbone , which are so - called D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's go through the entities mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Material Name:
 * IDT (indacenodithiophene)
 * NT (naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole))
 * PIDT-C12NT (polymer PIDT-C12NT, which is a copolymer of IDT and NT with a dodecyl side chain as a spacer)
 * PC71BM (6,6)-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester)
 * PC61BM (6,6)-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester)
2. Entities mentioned in the context of polymer solar cells:
 * BHJ (bulk - heterojunction)
 * PSCs (polymer solar cells)
 * donor / acceptor blend layer
 * low band gap conjugated polymers
 * fullerene derivatives (such as PC71BM and PC61BM)
 * HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital)
 * LUMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital)
 * V oc (open circuit voltage)
 * J sc (short circuit current)
3. Other entities:
 * spacers (used to separate the IDT and NT units in the copolymers)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the provided text:

1. IDT (indacenodithiophene)
2. NT (naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole))
3. PIDT-C12NT (polymer PIDT-C12NT, which is a copolymer of IDT and NT with a dodecyl side chain as a spacer)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities mentioned in the paragraph as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| IDT |
| NT |
| PIDT-C12NT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Three donor - acceptor type of narrow band gap conjugated polymers with enlarged coplanar skeleton were synthesized via Stille copolymerization of indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) based monomers. The results demonstrated that the combination of IDT and NT with appropriate spacers was a promising molecular design strategy for the application of solar cells . However , lowering HOMO level would result in larger band gap , and thereby the absorption of resulted polymers would have less overlap with solar spectrum , which are unfavorable for high short circuit current ( J sc ). To obtain the ideal low band gap polymer with appropriate energy levels that can make a tradeoff between open circuit voltage ( V oc ) and band gap so as to maximize the PCE , an intriguing approach involves incorporat - ing electron rich moieties ( donor , D ) and electron deficient moieties ( acceptor , A ) and alternating them on the backbone , which are so - called D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's go through the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Energy levels:
 * HOMO energy level of donor materials: Not mentioned explicitly, but can be inferred to be high since the paragraph mentions that deep HOMO levels are preferred for high Voc.
 * LUMO energy level of acceptor: Not mentioned explicitly, but can be inferred to be low since the paragraph mentions that lowering HOMO level would result in larger band gap.
2. Absorption spectra and band gaps:
 * Absorption coefficient of photoactive layer: Not mentioned explicitly, but can be inferred to be high since the paragraph mentions that the resulting polymers exhibited deep HOMO levels and subsequently lead to high open circuit voltages.
 * Band gap of the resulting polymers: Not mentioned explicitly, but can be inferred to be low since the paragraph mentions that the combination of IDT and NT with appropriate spacers was a promising molecular design strategy for the application of solar cells.
3. Material properties of the three copolymers:
 * PIDT-C12NT:
  + Energy levels: Deep HOMO levels for high Voc.
  + Absorption coefficient: High.
  + Band gap: Low.
 * Other two copolymers: Not mentioned explicitly.
4. Material properties of the best performing bulk - heterojunction solar cell:
 * PCE: 5.05%.
 * Donor: PIDT-C12NT.
 * Acceptor: (6,6)-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM).
 * Open circuit voltage (Voc): High.
 * Short circuit current (Jsc): High.

Note that some of these values are inferred or estimated based on the information provided in the paragraph, and may not be exact values.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to the value of material properties:

1. "deep HOMO levels" - This refers to the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) in a material, which is an important material property that affects the material's electronic properties.
2. "low band gap" - This refers to the energy gap between the valence band and conduction band of a material, which is an important material property that affects the material's electronic properties.
3. "high open circuit voltage" - This refers to the voltage that a solar cell can achieve when it is in its open-circuit state, which is an important material property that affects the solar cell's efficiency.
4. "high short circuit current" - This refers to the current that a solar cell can achieve when it is in its short-circuit state, which is an important material property that affects the solar cell's efficiency.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
